meanings.definition: A piece of furniture typically found in a hallway or entryway, used for hanging coats and storing other items.
meanings.sent1: The hallstand near the door held many coats and hats.
meanings.sent2: Visitors often hang their coats on the hallstand when they enter.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the hallstand was a great place to hide.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a well-organized hallstand, holding warmth and comfort for all.
meanings.sent5: The antique hallstand gleamed in the sunlight, inviting guests to make themselves at home.

meanings.definition: To place or store something on a hallstand.
meanings.sent1: She would hallstand her keys by the door every evening.
meanings.sent2: Please hallstand your umbrella on the rack to keep it dry.
meanings.sent3: He decided to hallstand his favorite book on the top shelf for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The memories hallstanded in her mind, ready to be revisited at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The chef would hallstand the freshly baked bread on the hallstand to cool down.
